content.detailedDescription: Object was round, giving off a silver light, it was noticed in the western sky as what appeared to be a shooting star descending from west to east, as the object grew closer we noticed it getting considerably brighter and brighter, until it was just as bright as the moon. many times brighter then the brightest star in the sky. as it passed overhead and continued east it appeared to 'wobble' up and down. the light was as bright coming towards us as it was going away from us, however began to fade as it gained distance until it was so far away it could not be seen anymore.  object moved from overhead to horizon in about 3.5 mins.  no strobes  lights were seen.  object seemed to maintain a flight line that did not take altitude into account, object also followed directly west to east.
content.summary: Spotted directly above moving west to east, dissapeared over horizon

content.detailedDescription: Saturday june 9th, 2012, 9:36 pm. huntington beach califronia. located north at 35 degrees from horizon. i was using my telescope in my backyard on a saturday night, looking at some stars with three other bystanders. as i was looking at random things, one of the witnesses told me, "hey, what is that bright red thing over there?" i looked at it (with my eyes) and it was a bright red dot looking thing and it just stood there at 35 degrees from the horizon on the north side for about 20 seconds and then moved slowly to the left (west) and suddenly changed direction to go up as in altitude and then vanished into thin air. all four of us saw the whole thing. what made us notice it was that it was as bright as an airplane light but a deep red color at where no airplane was seen or heard and i looked at my ipad after it vanished at an astronomy app at the recorded time and no satellite crossed its path, no airplane, meteor/meteor shower, or planet/star/comet. there was no change in feeling/attitude of all four of us except we were amazed by this finding. of course we did not lose sight of it, it just vanished slowly. the object was located about an acre away north from my house. when i first saw it, i thought it was a satellite until i checked my astronomy app at the recorded time.
content.summary: Small red dot, directional changes, then vanish. partly cloudy night.

content.detailedDescription: Driving on ramsey st towards skibo rd.  noticed bright stationary lights in the sky, thought it was a plane then radio tower until closer inspection.  it stayed stationary for entirety of viewing.  couldn't stop looking at it until line of sight was broken by treeline.  then was no longer visible.
I had this narrative and the above  fill out  and lost it. for more info you can call me : cell 1708-543-4527

I was out camping with my boyfriend for the first time at carson hole in the uncompaghre national forest in colorado. we live only a half hour but decided to stay for only one night. everything was fine during the day, there was nothing abnormal at dusk either. when night finally fell (around 9 o'clock in colorado) we were laying in the tent without the rain fly on so we could look at the stars. the conversation was casual and suddenly we heard a pack of coyotes. they began howling not far from us and then began to scream. it was a sound that i had never heard from any animal even while hunting and spending time outdoors. it lasted approximately 30 seconds and then stopped abruptly. moments after, we both saw a bright flash just above us as though you would see from a digital camera although it was extremely concentrated as though something had just taken off. a few minutes later the first craft was observed near the tree to the right of us. it appeared slowly and then grew brighter and dulled as it moved across the sky until it faded away after hovering. the final craft was approximately 15 minutes later and again appear right above us, lit up so that you could see the border on the ship and the 3 main lights in the center. we watched it move across the sky for approximately 10 seconds before it disappeared in the blink of an eye.

this area is so secluded and at such a high altitude that there is little aircraft interference that you witness. the crafts did not blink as an airplane nor behave accordingly. we heard the coyote screams twice more in the night before fading into nothing. i am surprised there have not been more sightings. we were both completely sober and very aware of what we saw. it appears as a simple sighting but never in my life have i felt such terror in those moments that we witnessed the objects. we both wanted to leave but were honestly too afraid to leave the tent or move inside of it never the less grab and pack all of our belongings that were spread around the camp sight. the rest of the night i heard footsteps and we both felt nausea and stomach pain and i experienced a long lasting headache.
content.summary: Rectangular, blue glowing edges with three horizontal lights in the middle

this area is so secluded and at such a high altitude that there is little aircraft interference that you witness. the crafts did not blink as an airplane nor behave accordingly. we heard the coyote screams twice more in the night before fading into nothing. i am surprised there have not been more sightings. we were both completely sober and very aware of what we saw. it appears as a simple sighting but never in my life have i felt such terror in those moments that we witnessed the objects. we both wanted to leave but were honestly too afraid to leave the tent or move inside of it never the less grab and pack all of our belongings that were spread around the camp sight.

content.detailedDescription: I was camping and fishing at lake eufaulla when i saw lights in the sky i watched them for a few minutes as they came closer to the waters surface completely silent.. it hovered over the water and all lights went off. i could still see it clearly in the moon light triangular/teardrop in shape ... huge at least 90 ft. wide maybe 20 tall.   something cylindrical extended from beneath and touched the surface of the water it stayed that way for about 5 minutes then it went back in and the object very quickly went back up so fast the water splashed and made waves once it was up about 300 ft the lights came back on and it sped off north and up.  not ten minutes later there was a large black chopper with only one small tail light circled the area then hovered in the same area for no more that 15 sec. spotlighting the water.  then it too left in the same directions... i dont want people to think im nuts so i dont want to give my name.  but i know what i saw.. i was pretty close and nothing that big man made can be that quiet and quick.
content.summary: Came down turned off lights hovered over water appendage touched water went back in then it left straight up

content.detailedDescription: It was memorial day weekend that saturday and my husband and i and went to visit some family where we were going to have a bbq and i was going to lay out back to get some sun with my friend. well they had to leave unexpectly and told us to relax and make out selves at home. while i was getting ready to lay down my phone accidentlally took a picture of the sky when i noticed what it was i stood up and took another pic in the same direction it revealed a trail of some sort. when i first saw the photos i didn't know what to think but there really wasn't anything to distort the pictures. it was about 2:00 in the afternoon and the sky was clear and it was very warm out. it looks like a blue orb of some sort. i did not see anything with my naked eye it was only visible via my pictures.
content.summary: My camera accidental snapped a picture in the sky and a blue orb was in the photo

content.detailedDescription: I was outside with my girlfriend smoking cigarettes at the red lion inn in front of our room in sacramento and looking up at the night sky. we observed and noted the big dipper constellation. i then noticed a bluish light a bit larger in size than the stars making up the big dipper. i asked my girlfriend if she saw it and confirmed she did as well. we both observed this light move from east to west over sacramento. it blinked on and off about every 5 seconds. there was no visible clouds at all. this ruled out the blinking of the object to be from passing behind clouds. we heard no sounds at all overhead. the object moved from just under the handle of the big dipper to above the star arcturus in about 20 seconds. it then continued across the sky another 10 seconds and then changed direction in a right angle turn that appeared to head downwards as if coming to an abrupt stop and then descending. the object appeared to descend for about 5 seconds and then disappeared entirely. the time durations are based on the blinking interval that seemed to again be every 5 seconds. the object was nearly invisible to the naked eye and would only be seen every 5 seconds when it emitted a bright blink or flash that was bluish in color. it was like tracking a firefly flying across your backyard. i noted the time of the event after first seeing the object. it was a full 11 minutes before the iss was supposed to transit the sky. i do not believe it was the space station. there were no meteor showers anticipated for the evening either. i have seen "shooting stars" and this did not match what i have seen during meteor showers. there were no other colored lights such as red to indicate this was a commercial or military aircraft. i may be tempted to believe this was a satellite except for the sharp stop and direction changed we observed.
content.summary: Bluish pulsating light moving east to west over sacramento
